items.headline: Bond-market volatility plunges ahead of Fed policy decision. What are investors expecting?
items.summary_en: Volatility in the bond market has plunged in October ahead of the Fed’s policy decision on Wednesday. Here’s what investors are expecting — and what could shake their confidence.

items.headline: U.S. says $80 billion worth of nuclear reactors will be built. Cameco’s stock jumps.
items.summary_en: The U.S. government announced a pact to build at least $80 billion worth of nuclear reactors, in a pact to meet the growing power demands caused by artificial intelligence.

items.headline: Royal Caribbean sees cruise demand accelerate — but here’s why the stock is dropping
items.summary_en: Royal Caribbean Group shares were falling Tuesday as the cruise operator’s revenue again came up short, despite better-than-expected quarterly profit and an improved full-year outlook.

items.headline: How a few new crypto ETFs slipped through the cracks of the government shutdown
items.summary_en: To many people’s surprise, a few exchange-traded funds investing in lesser-known cryptocurrencies were launched in the U.S. on Tuesday, despite a government shutdown.

items.headline: Home builders are struggling, and it’s not just because new houses aren’t affordable
items.summary_en: D.R. Horton’s results show that the market for newly built homes continues to slow, as affordability issues, as well as worries about the economy and the job market, are keeping buyers on the fence.

items.headline: Microsoft’s stock rises as new OpenAI partnership comes as a relief to investors
items.summary_en: The new agreement values Microsoft’s 27% stake at $135 billion and extends its IP rights through 2032, giving Microsoft investors “upside optionality.”
